function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Rapid change in social behaviors and habits","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Use of online survey may lead to low response rate due to survey fatigue and lack of interest","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Spread of misinformation or false data through unverified social media channels and personal contacts","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Low ethics in using wbe","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Spatial-statistical analysis of the covid-19 pandemic may expose unprotected marginalized populations to the risk of stigmatization and discrimination","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for occupancy rates and physical distancing in strategies","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of detailed strategies for social distancing and maximum occupancy in buildings, increasing the risk of airborne cross-infection.","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Company policies are typically preventive measures, easier to implement, and likely to be adopted at early stages.","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Limited awareness and compliance with safety guidelines","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"People not following covid-19 protocols such as maintaining six feet distance and other health protocols","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Shift in social behavior and neighborhood dynamics due to covid-19","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for post-pandemic behaviors in public spaces.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of proper communication leading to risk perception among the public and affecting societal response to the pandemic.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of public awareness and education about preventive measures and accurate information","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Failure to follow established protocols and safety procedures by healthcare workers","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Critique of the biodiversity-buffers-disease paradigm","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Non-linear relationship between biodiversity and dilution effect","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Adding non-competent and competent host species in city environments","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Increase in biodiversity may lead to proliferation of pest and harmful organisms in urban environments.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Disease-protective effects of biodiversity may not effectively reduce the transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Increased prevalence of human schistosomiasis from dam constructions","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Arsenic exposure in bangladesh from construction of tube wells","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Presence of sars-cov-2 in human wastewater","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Enteric involvement in hospitalised patients with covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Unavailability of the exact number of covid-19 positive patients","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Immunosuppression in asymptomatic liver transplant recipients","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Potential enteric transmission of sars-cov-2","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Potential community spread of sars-cov-2","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Potential transmission of covid-19 in tourism destinations due to reduced risk perception and information mismanagement","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Negative influence on country and destination image due to misinformation and racial references related to covid-19","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Lack of detail-oriented behavior and increased spontaneous trait inferences leading to risk of epidemic spread","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Psychological distance and construal level theory influencing perceived risk in tourism contexts may lead to inaccurate risk perceptions.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Individuals’ varying construal of psychological distance and covid-19-related risk perceptions may lead to inconsistent travel willingness and preferences.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Dissemination of negative messages through social media may exacerbate country image problems and increase anxiety among tourists.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases in small accommodation units due to shortened social distance with tourists","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Person-to-person transmission of contagious diseases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Shift in tourist preferences due to covid-19","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Increased preference for private transportation over public transportation","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Perceived health risks related to covid-19 in tourism activities","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Psychological risks related to anxiety and fear about covid-19","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Tourists consuming foreign or exotic foods may be blamed for disease transmission, leading to social risk.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Biased risk perceptions of covid-19, with individuals perceiving their own risk as lower than others.","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Differences in risk perceptions based on demographic characteristics, cultural background, and socio-psychological features.","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Tourists may engage in novelty-seeking behavior, leading to increased risk of contracting contagious diseases.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Wildlife consumption by tourists may lead to the transmission of zoonotic diseases and global health epidemics.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Public concern and criticism of wildlife consumption may lead to heated debates and social unrest, impacting tourism and local communities.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Tourists modifying transportation modes to prefer self-driving tours or recreational vehicles, leading to potential increase in road accidents and traffic congestion.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Tourists avoiding public transport due to fear of contracting illnesses, leading to decreased usage of public transport and potential overcrowding of roads and highways.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Preference for private car services leading to decreased social distancing and increased risk of disease transmission within the vehicle.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Psychological reservations affecting destination choices","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"Low"}]}
